author: Elastic
description: Identifies use of the built-in Windows script interpreters (cscript.exe or wscript.exe) being used to execute a process via Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI). This may be indicative of malicious activity.
name: Windows Script Interpreter Executing Process via WMI
query:
sequence by host.id with maxspan = 5s
    [library where dll.name : "wmiutils.dll" and process.name : ("wscript.exe", "cscript.exe")]
    [process where event.type in ("start", "process_started") and
     process.parent.name : "wmiprvse.exe" and
     user.domain != "NT AUTHORITY" and
     (process.pe.original_file_name :
        (
          "cscript.exe",
          "wscript.exe",
          "PowerShell.EXE",
          "Cmd.Exe",
          "MSHTA.EXE",
          "RUNDLL32.EXE",
          "REGSVR32.EXE",
          "MSBuild.exe",
          "InstallUtil.exe",
          "RegAsm.exe",
          "RegSvcs.exe",
          "msxsl.exe",
          "CONTROL.EXE",
          "EXPLORER.EXE",
          "Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe",
          "msiexec.exe"
        ) or
      process.executable : ("C:\\Users\\*.exe", "C:\\ProgramData\\*.exe")
     )
    ]
